Package org.ontal.imgutil

Class ImgUtil

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.ontal.imgutil.ImgUtil
  • public final class ImgUtil
extends Object
    This utility allows advanced image transformations based on initial parameters and selected transformation strategy.

    There are several transofmation strategies available: Fit, Adjust, Expand, Tile and Limit. Each strategy requires certain minimal parameters set via Settings class while others are deduced during the image processing.


    Adjust strategy

    In case target ratio is different from the original scales the image adding borders. Borders background color is configured separately via Settings.setBackgroundRGB(int[]).

    Useful for standardizing output images.

    Required Settings parameters:
    • ImageSize - if has only one dimmension defined then the other is calculated from the provided ratio, otherwise Ratio parameter can be omitted or set to AUTO
    • ImageRatio - target ratio
    • ImageFormat - output format
    • Strategy.ADJUST

    Example1: new Settings(new ImageSize(200, null), ImageRatio.X1Y1, ImageFormat.PNG, Strategy.ADJUST);
    Example2: new Settings(new ImageSize(300, 200), ImageFormat.PNG, Strategy.ADJUST);



    Limit strategy

    The image is scaled to fit into Y or X limit defined in pixels while maintaining its original ratio. If the original corresponding dimmension is smaller than the defined limit no changes are applied.

    Useful for setting a dimmensional limit for big images.

    Required Settings parameters:
    • ImageSize that defines one dimmension only in pixels to fit to
    • ImageFormat - output format
    • Strategy.LIMIT

    Example: new Settings(new ImageSize(200, null), ImageFormat.PNG, Strategy.LIMIT);


    Since:
    May 2012
    Author:
    akaine

    • Method Detail

      • transformAndWrite

        public static void transformAndWrite​(String inputPath,
                                     String outputDir,
                                     String outputName,
                                     Settings settings)
                              throws SettingsException,
                                     IOException
        Reads image from the local file system, transforms it acording to the configuration defined in Settings and saves its transformed version in the local file system.
        Parameters:
        inputPath - input image absolute file path
        outputDir - output directory path (without separator at the end)
        outputName - output image file name (without extension)
        settings - image transformations configuration
        Throws:
        SettingsException - in case of invalid settings
        IOException - in case of an I/O error
